alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 02 at 6:58PM CST until March 04 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC005-031300- /O.CON.KOUN.FL.Y.0001.000000T0000Z-230305T0000Z/ /CANO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 658 PM CST Thu Mar 2 2023 ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, The creek remains within its banks in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet Saturday morning. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
